intro: Callista gracilicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed callista, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species. It is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ecological value in supporting pollinators.
